provider of the football pads Michael Vick wore most of last season. The deal will be announced on Thursday. ''We're real excited about it,'' chief executive officer Rob Vito said Tuesday. Michael Vick is good people. He paid his dues. Barack Obama reached out to him. He deserves an opportunity. This is what makes America so great. He's moved forward. He's a whole other person. Before his 2007 arrest on dogfighting charges, Michael Vick was the NFL's highest paid player and had numerous endorsements. Vito said Michael Vick is the company's first corporate spokesman. Terms of his deal weren't disclosed
